meanings.definition: A container filled with sand for children to play in.
meanings.sent1: The children built a castle in the sandbox at the park.
meanings.sent2: The sandbox at the school playground is always busy with kids playing.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought the sandbox was a giant litter box!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a sandbox of creativity, full of endless possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The sandbox sparkled in the sunlight, inviting the children to come and play.

meanings.definition: A protected environment for testing computer programs.
meanings.sent1: The developers used the sandbox to test the new software before releasing it.
meanings.sent2: It is important to test programs in a sandbox to prevent any harm to the system.
meanings.sent3: The computer virus felt lost in the sandbox, unable to cause any damage.
meanings.sent4: The sandbox of code allowed the programmers to experiment freely.
meanings.sent5: In the digital sandbox, errors can be easily fixed before going live.
